Preventing errors with IF, ISERR and ISEMPTY

The ISERR and ISEMPTY functions can detect ERROR and EMPTY error values. The IF function can be combined with these functions to prevent the whole formula from returning an error.

For example, the following formula substitutes the value for PULSE whenever data is unavailable for the sporadic variable PULSNI:

IF ( ISEMPTY ( [PULSNI] ), [PULSE], [PULSNI] )

Tip: You can use real-time variables that are not part of the patient chart as temporary values to simplify other formulas.
